front.title: Service Authentication Architecture Using Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) Key

abstract.t: In a public wireless local area network (WLAN) access service using Mobile IP, network elements (NEs), such as access points (APs), DHCP server (DHCPS) and home agents (HAs), are required to authenticate users to prevent unauthorized usage. In this document, we discuss authentication/authorization process using Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) key derived during access authentication.
